appearances.title: Washington Journal Rep. Eric Sorensen D-IL : CSPAN2 : January 16, 2026 2:26am-2:41am EST
appearances.snippet: about issues concerning congress and the white house, this is representative eric sorensen, a member of the armed services committee and democrat from illinois. when it comes to the recent statements about the u.s. interest in greenland, what do you make the case of the u.s. is making? guest: i am proud to have danish heritage. i share the last name as the danish ambassador to the united states. we talk regularly about this, but let us understand what this administration is trying to do. i sit on the armed services committee. we have enough defense. we have been working with nato and working with denmark. they have provided us the land use that we need in greenland. there is no reason why we would need to have greenland. when you look at our defense against russia across the arctic circle, we have alaska. we have our state right up there, which actually goes north of the area inhabited in greenland. it is preposterous and another shiny object that administration is putting in front of the american people. host: i want to play a little bit from the president who specifically mentioned
